intro: Hyoseris tubaeformis, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies, roadsides, and fields. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hyoseris tubaeformis is known for its adaptability and resilience in various environmental conditions.
